lead_paragraph: They had braved risks and hardships to get to Greece, but at least 202 migrants were sent back to Turkey on Monday, the first day of such deportations.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ceylan Yeginsu from Dikili, Turkey; Nikolas Leontopoulos from Mytilene; James Kanter from Brussels; and Melissa Eddy from Berlin.

headline.print_headline: Immediate Deportations Begin for Asylum Seekers Who Make It to Greece
headline.main: Greece Starts Deporting Migrants to Turkey as E.U. Deal Takes Effect

snippet: They had braved risks and hardships to get to Greece, but at least 202 migrants were sent back to Turkey on Monday, the first day of such deportations.
abstract: Greek authorities begin deporting newly arrived migrants to Turkey, sending back 202 in initial action; deportations are part of deal arranged with Turkey in March.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
